intro: Palicourea membranifolia, commonly known as the membranous palicourea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in humid, shaded environments. The plant features elliptical, leathery leaves with a distinctive membranous texture on the underside. Its small, white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, round berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
